H0.text: Area is the physical property most likely being compared when a teacher tells the class that a bowling ball has more inertia than a basketball.

H1.text: Mass is the physical property most likely being compared when a teacher discusses that a bowling ball has more inertia than a basketball.

H2.text: Weight is the physical property most likely being compared by the teacher when stating that a bowling ball has more inertia than a basketball.

H3.text: Volume is the physical property most likely being compared when a teacher discusses with a class that a bowling ball has more inertia than a basketball.

A4.text: one says the body of greater mass has greater inertia.

A5.text: An object on the Moon would weigh less than it does on Earth because of the lower gravity, but it would still have the same mass.
